Hero.slide0_subtitle: In just a few hours, travel from cool mountain air to tropical beaches filled with endless possibilities.
Hero.slide1_title: Sunsets, Safaris, and Stories to Remember
Hero.slide1_subtitle: Experience breathtaking horizons, close encounters with wildlife, and flavors that stay with you forever.
Hero.slide2_title: From Tea Trails to Turtle Shores
Hero.slide2_subtitle: Wander through emerald tea plantations by day and watch sea turtles nest under moonlit skies.
Hero.slide3_title: Where Golden Beaches Meet Ancient Wonders
Hero.slide3_subtitle: From sunrise surf in Arugam Bay to sacred temples in Anuradhapura, every corner tells a story waiting to be lived.
Hero.slide4_title: Wander Through the Beauty of Hillside Road
Hero.slide4_subtitle: Drive along winding mountain paths, where rolling tea hills, cool breezes, and breathtaking views unfold at every turn.
Hero.slide5_title: Slow Down. Sit by the Window. Let Sri Lanka Roll By
Hero.slide5_subtitle: Open doors, cool breezes, and landscapes so beautiful they feel unreal.

Tours.description1: Discover Sri Lanka’s most famous wildlife sanctuary on an exciting safari adventure. Yala National Park is home to elephants, leopards, crocodiles, deer, and a wide variety of birds. Travel through diverse landscapes of jungle, grasslands, and lagoons while experiencing nature up close with expert guides.
Tours.description2: Step into Sri Lanka’s ancient history with a visit to the iconic Sigiriya Rock Fortress and the sacred Dambulla Cave Temple. Climb Sigiriya to enjoy breathtaking views and explore centuries-old frescoes, then admire the beautifully painted Buddha statues inside Dambulla’s cave temples.
Tours.description3: Explore the heart of Sri Lanka’s hill country surrounded by rolling green tea estates and cool mountain air. Learn how world-famous Ceylon tea is produced, visit traditional tea factories, and enjoy fresh tea tastings while taking in stunning landscapes and colonial charm.
Tours.description4: Set sail on an unforgettable ocean journey to witness majestic blue whales, playful dolphins, and other marine life in their natural habitat. These coastal waters are among the best places in the world for whale watching, offering a truly once-in-a-lifetime experience.
Tours.description5: Explore the historic coastal city of Galle, famous for its well-preserved Dutch Fort, charming streets, and ocean views. Walk along ancient ramparts, visit colonial buildings, enjoy local cafés, and relax on nearby beaches while soaking up the city’s unique heritage.
Tours.description6: Travel through Sri Lanka’s cultural heartland and discover its deep spiritual and historical roots. Visit sacred temples, ancient capitals, and UNESCO-listed heritage sites, including the revered Temple of the Tooth, while learning about centuries-old traditions and royal civilizations.
Tours.description7: Experience the breathtaking beauty of Sri Lanka’s hill country in Ella. Visit lush waterfalls, misty viewpoints, and the famous Nine Arches Bridge, surrounded by tea plantations and green valleys. This tour is perfect for nature lovers, photographers, and relaxed explorers.

HomeFAQ.subtitle: Booking Q&A
HomeFAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
HomeFAQ.q0: What is the best time to visit Sri Lanka?
HomeFAQ.a0: Sri Lanka is a year-round destination! However, the best time to visit the west and south coasts and hill country is from December to April, while the east coast weather is best from May to October.
HomeFAQ.a1: Yes, we provide comfortable and reliable airport pickup and drop-off services for all our guests. Just let us know your flight details and we will handle the rest.
HomeFAQ.q2: Is Sri Lanka safe for tourists?
HomeFAQ.a2: Absolutely! Sri Lanka is known for its warm hospitality and is considered one of the safest travel destinations in Asia. Our guides are experienced and prioritize your safety at all times.
HomeFAQ.q3: Will I have a dedicated driver and vehicle?
HomeFAQ.a3: Yes, all our customized and planned tours come with a fully air-conditioned, comfortable vehicle and a dedicated, English-speaking professional chauffeur-guide.
HomeFAQ.a4: Of course! While we have carefully crafted tour packages, you can customize any aspect of them. We tailor itineraries based on your budget, interests, and schedule.
HomeFAQ.q5: Can you help with obtaining a visa to Sri Lanka?
HomeFAQ.a5: While you must apply for your Electronic Travel Authorization (ETA) online, our team can provide you with all the necessary guidance and documentation needed for a smooth application process.
HomeFAQ.q6: Do you offer tours in multiple languages?
HomeFAQ.a6: Yes, we can arrange guides who speak languages such as German, French, Spanish, Italian, and more upon request and availability. English-speaking guides are standard.
HomeFAQ.q7: How early should I book my tour?
HomeFAQ.a7: We recommend booking at least 1-2 months in advance, especially during the peak seasons (December-April and July-August) to ensure accommodation and guide availability.

yala-national-park-safari.title: Yala National Park Safari
yala-national-park-safari.subtitle: Wildlife Encounters at Sri Lanka's Most Famous Park
yala-national-park-safari.description: Experience the ultimate wildlife safari in Yala National Park, home to the highest density of leopards in the world. Our expert trackers will take you deep into the bush to discover elephants, sloth bears, exotic birds, and crocodiles in their natural habitat. Explore the arid woodland, grassy plains, and coastal ecosystems.

plan.title: Morning Safari & Forest Exploration
activities: 5:30 AM: Pick up from your hotel in Tissamaharama or Yala area.
6:00 AM: Enter Yala National Park as the gates open.
Experience the early morning active phase of wildlife, looking for leopards.
10:00 AM: Stop by the beach inside the park for a quick breakfast.
11:00 AM: Return to your hotel.

sigiriya-dambulla-day-trip.title: Sigiriya & Dambulla Heritage Tour
sigiriya-dambulla-day-trip.subtitle: Discover the wonders of Sigiriya & Dambulla with our experienced tour. Explore ancient rock fortresses, golden temples, and UNESCO cultural heritage.
sigiriya-dambulla-day-trip.description:
Our Sigiriya & Dambulla Heritage Tour takes you deep into Sri Lanka's rich history, blending nature, history and breathtaking landscapes. Walk through the legendary Sigiriya Rock Fortress, marvel at its ancient frescoes, and find inner peace at the Dambulla Cave Temple. This unforgettable journey is perfect for culture enthusiasts and nature lovers alike. With comfortable transport and expert guides, we promise an immersive experience. Book now to uncover the true magic of Sri Lanka’s ancient wonders!

Join our guided tour to Sigiriya & Dambulla and dive into the cultural heart of Sri Lanka. Book your adventure today to discover centuries-old history and breathtaking views.
includes: Private A/C Transportation with Driver Guide
Entrance fees to Dambulla Cave Temple
Entrance Fees for Sigiriya Rock Fortress

plan.title: Hotel Pick-Up & Departure
activities: Morning pick up from your hotel in Kandy, Colombo, or Negombo.
Enjoy a scenic drive through the Sri Lankan countryside.

plan.title: Sigiriya Rock Fortress Climb
activities: Arrive at the world-famous Sigiriya Rock, commonly called the 8th Wonder of the World.
Explore the ancient water gardens, mirror wall, and lion paws before ascending.
Enjoy panoramic views from the top.

plan.title: Traditional Sri Lankan Lunch
activities: Stop at a local restaurant to enjoy an authentic rice and curry lunch.

plan.title: Dambulla Cave Temple Visit
activities: Explore the largest and best-preserved cave temple complex in Sri Lanka.
Admire over 150 Buddha statues and ancient murals covering the cave walls.

plan.title: Return Journey
activities: Relax during the drive back to your hotel, bringing unforgettable memories.

tea-plantation-tour.title: Tea Plantation Tour (Ella / Nuwara Eliya)
tea-plantation-tour.subtitle: Discover the Secrets of Ceylon Tea
tea-plantation-tour.description: Immerse yourself in the emerald green landscapes of Sri Lanka's hill country. Follow the journey of a tea leaf from the lush fields picked by skilled pluckers to the bustling factory where it is graded and refined. Taste the world's finest Ceylon tea straight from the source while surrounded by panoramic views of the misty mountains.

plan.title: Scenic Drive & Plantation Walk
activities: Pick up from your hotel.
Drive through winding roads surrounded by tea estates.
Walk through the fields and interact with local tea pluckers.

plan.title: Factory Tour & Tasting
activities: Detailed guided tour inside a historic tea factory.
Learn about the withering, rolling, and drying processes.
Enjoy a freshly brewed cup of premium Ceylon tea.

whale-dolphin-watching.title: Whale & Dolphin Watching (Mirissa)
whale-dolphin-watching.subtitle: A Thrilling Deep-Sea Ocean Safari
whale-dolphin-watching.description: Set sail across the warm waters of the Indian Ocean to witness the giants of the sea. Mirissa is one of the best places in the world to reliably spot Blue Whales, Sperm Whales, and pods of playful dolphins. This early morning deep-sea cruise is a must-do for nature and wildlife lovers.

plan.title: Ocean Safari Adventure
activities: 6:00 AM: Arrive at Mirissa Harbor and board the vessel.
6:30 AM: Set sail into the deep ocean.
Spend hours watching for water blowholes indicating Blue Whales.
11:00 AM: Return to the harbor after a successful expedition.

plan.title: Beach Relaxation
activities: Spend the rest of the day relaxing on Mirissa or Unawatuna beach.
Enjoy fresh seafood by the ocean.

galle-full-day-journey.title: Galle Full-Day Journey Day Tour
galle-full-day-journey.subtitle: Southern Coastal Delights and Colonial History
galle-full-day-journey.description: Explore the historic streets and sunny beaches of the magnificent Galle Fort. Walk along the ramparts, visit the iconic lighthouse, and get lost in the narrow cobblestone streets lined with Dutch-colonial buildings, boutique shops, and cafes.

plan.title: Coastal Stops & Galle Discovery
activities: Morning departure, stopping at the Kosgoda Turtle Hatchery.
Arrive at Galle Fort and explore the lighthouse and ramparts.
Free time for shopping and dining in the Fort area.
Return trip along the scenic coastline.

cultural-triangle-history.title: Cultural Triangle & History Tour
cultural-triangle-history.subtitle: Journey Through the Sacred Heartland of Sri Lanka
cultural-triangle-history.description: Immerse yourself in history going through the sacred Temples of the Tooth, ancient capitals of Anuradhapura and Polonnaruwa, and more. This multi-day journey highlights the peak of Sri Lanka's ancient civilizations.
includes: Guided tours of major heritage sites

plan.title: Anuradhapura & Mihintale
activities: Explore the first ancient capital.
Visit the sacred Bodhi Tree.

plan.title: Kandy Temple & Traditions
activities: Visit the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic.
Enjoy a traditional cultural dance show.

ella-scenic-wonders.title: Ella Scenic Wonders & Nine Arches
ella-scenic-wonders.subtitle: Majestic Mountains, Waterfalls, and the Iconic Railway
ella-scenic-wonders.description: Experience scenic views, waterfalls, and the timeless Nine Arches bridge in the breathtaking hill country. Hike up to Little Adam’s Peak for panoramic views stretching across the southern plains.

plan.title: Little Adam's Peak & Nine Arches
activities: Easy morning hike to Little Adam's Peak.
Visit the Nine Arches Bridge as the train passes.
Relax at a local cafe in Ella town.

sigiriya-rock-fortress.title: Sigiriya Rock Fortress - Ancient Palace in the Sky
sigiriya-rock-fortress.description_1: A UNESCO World Heritage site, Sigiriya is a massive column of rock nearly 200 meters high. Built by King Kasyapa in the 5th century, it served as both a palace and a fortress.
sigiriya-rock-fortress.description_2: The site is renowned for its ancient frescoes of maidens, the mirror wall filled with ancient graffiti, and the monumental lion paws at the entrance to the final ascent.
sigiriya-rock-fortress.highlight_1: Climb the 1200 steps to the summit for breathtaking panoramic views of the jungle.
sigiriya-rock-fortress.highlight_2: Admire the ancient water gardens and intricate ancient plumbing systems.
sigiriya-rock-fortress.highlight_3: View the world-famous Sigiriya Frescoes painted inside a sheer rock face.
sigiriya-rock-fortress.highlight_4: Walk past the towering Lion Paws terrace before the final climb.
sigiriya-rock-fortress.best_time: Early morning (7:00 AM) or late afternoon to avoid the intense heat and crowds.
sigiriya-rock-fortress.dress_code: Light, comfortable clothing, sunscreen, and sturdy walking shoes or sneakers are highly recommended.
sigiriya-rock-fortress.why_choose: Sigiriya is often referred to as the Eighth Wonder of the World and is universally considered a must-visit for anyone traveling to Sri Lanka.
sigiriya-rock-fortress.subtitle: Sigiriya

ella.title: Ella - The Mist-Covered Mountain Paradise
ella.description_1: Ella is a small, scenic town located in the highlands of Sri Lanka. Known for its laid-back atmosphere, cool climate, and stunning views of the Ella Gap.
ella.description_2: The region is surrounded by rolling tea plantations, cloud forests, and waterfalls, making it one of the top destinations for hiking and nature lovers.
ella.highlight_1: Hike the easy trail up Little Adam's Peak for incredible sunrise views.
ella.highlight_2: Watch trains pass over the iconic Nine Arches Bridge built entirely without steel.
ella.highlight_3: Take a refreshing dip at the base of the spectacular Ravana Falls.
ella.highlight_4: Enjoy relaxed evenings at the vibrant cafes and restaurants in Ella town.
ella.best_time: January to May when the weather is cool, dry, and offers the clearest views.
ella.dress_code: Layers are important. Warm clothes for chilly evenings, and comfortable hiking gear for daytime exploring.
ella.why_choose: Ella offers the perfect mix of adventure, relaxation, breath-taking natural scenery, and a vibrant traveler community.
ella.subtitle: Hill Town

kandy.title: Kandy - The Cultural Capital of Sri Lanka
kandy.description_1: Kandy is a large city in central Sri Lanka. It's set on a plateau surrounded by mountains, which are home to tea plantations and biodiverse rainforests.
kandy.description_2: The city's heart is scenic Kandy Lake (Bogambara Lake), which is popular for strolling. Kandy is famously known around the world as the home of the sacred Temple of the Tooth.
kandy.highlight_1: Visit the Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic, housing a tooth of the Buddha.
kandy.highlight_2: Stroll around the beautiful man-made Kandy Lake at the center of the city.
kandy.highlight_3: Explore the Royal Botanical Gardens in Peradeniya, home to over 4000 species of plants.
kandy.highlight_4: Witness a vibrant traditional Kandyan cultural dance performance in the evening.
kandy.best_time: December to April when the climate is cool and dry. The Esala Perahera festival usually takes place in July or August.
kandy.dress_code: Modest clothing is required for temples (shoulders and knees must be covered), and white is the preferred color.
kandy.why_choose: Kandy is the cultural and spiritual heart of Sri Lanka, offering a deep dive into the island's rich heritage and traditions.
kandy.subtitle: Cultural Capital

galle-fort.title: Galle Fort - A Walk Through Colonial History
galle-fort.description_1: Galle Fort, in the Bay of Galle on the southwest coast of Sri Lanka, was built first in 1588 by the Portuguese, and then extensively fortified by the Dutch during the 17th century.
galle-fort.description_2: It is a historical, archaeological, and architectural heritage monument, which even after more than 432 years maintains a polished appearance and a vibrant, artsy atmosphere.
galle-fort.highlight_1: Walk the ancient ramparts for spectacular views of the Indian Ocean, especially at sunset.
galle-fort.highlight_2: Photograph the iconic Galle Lighthouse, one of the oldest in the country.
galle-fort.highlight_3: Explore the narrow streets lined with Dutch-colonial buildings, boutique shops, and cafes.
galle-fort.highlight_4: Visit the Dutch Reformed Church and the Historical Mansion Museum.
galle-fort.best_time: December to April offers the best coastal weather, but the Fort is charming year-round.
galle-fort.dress_code: Casual, breathable clothing. Comfortable walking shoes are essential for the cobblestone streets.
galle-fort.why_choose: Galle Fort uniquely blends European architectural styles with South Asian traditions, offering a relaxed and historically rich atmosphere.
galle-fort.subtitle: Galle

yala-national-park.title: Yala National Park - Into the Wild
yala-national-park.description_1: Yala is Sri Lanka's most visited and second-largest national park. It consists of five blocks, though only two are open to the public.
yala-national-park.description_2: The park is renowned for its variety of wild animals. It is important for the conservation of Sri Lankan elephants, Sri Lankan leopards, and aquatic birds.
yala-national-park.highlight_1: Embark on an exciting 4x4 jeep safari to spot the elusive Sri Lankan leopard.
yala-national-park.highlight_2: Observe large herds of wild elephants roaming freely through the scrub jungle.
yala-national-park.highlight_3: Spot a vast array of bird species, including majestic peacocks and eagles.
yala-national-park.highlight_4: Experience the diverse landscapes, varying from open parkland to dense jungle.
yala-national-park.best_time: February to June offers the best wildlife viewing as animals congregate around water sources.
yala-national-park.dress_code: Neutral-colored, comfortable clothing. Bring a hat, sunglasses, and dust protection.
yala-national-park.why_choose: Yala offers one of the highest leopard densities in the world, making it a premier destination for wildlife enthusiasts and photographers.
yala-national-park.subtitle: Wildlife Safari

nuwara-eliya.title: Nuwara Eliya - The 'Little England' of Sri Lanka
nuwara-eliya.description_1: Nuwara Eliya is a city in the tea country hills of central Sri Lanka. It is known for its temperate, cool climate and colonial-era bungalows.
nuwara-eliya.description_2: The naturally landscaped Hakgala Botanical Gardens display roses and tree ferns, while monkeys and blue magpies inhabit the nearby single-tree hill and Galway's Land National Park.
nuwara-eliya.highlight_1: Visit a working tea factory to learn about the production of world-famous Ceylon tea.
nuwara-eliya.highlight_2: Enjoy a scenic boat ride or peaceful walk around Lake Gregory.
nuwara-eliya.highlight_3: Admire the colonial architecture of the Grand Hotel and the Hill Club.
nuwara-eliya.highlight_4: Take a stroll through the vibrant Victoria Park in the center of town.
nuwara-eliya.best_time: February to May, with April being the peak season for the Nuwara Eliya season festivals.
nuwara-eliya.dress_code: Warm clothing is essential, especially in the evenings. Jackets and sweaters are recommended.
nuwara-eliya.why_choose: Nuwara Eliya offers a unique, cool escape with stunning landscapes and a fascinating glimpse into Sri Lanka's colonial tea-growing history.
nuwara-eliya.subtitle: Tea Estates

mirissa.title: Mirissa - Sun, Surf, and Majestic Whales
mirissa.description_1: Mirissa is a small town on the south coast of Sri Lanka. Its beach and nightlife make it a popular tourist destination, but it's most famous for its marine life.
mirissa.description_2: Mirissa is one of the best places in the world to reliably see blue whales, sperm whales, and dolphins in their natural habitat.
mirissa.highlight_1: Embark on an early morning whale-watching cruise to see majestic blue whales.
mirissa.highlight_2: Relax on the pristine, crescent-shaped sandy beach and enjoy fresh seafood.
mirissa.highlight_3: Climb Coconut Tree Hill for a breathtaking sunset over the Indian Ocean.
mirissa.highlight_4: Enjoy the vibrant yet laid-back beachside nightlife.
mirissa.best_time: November to April offers the calmest seas for whale watching.
mirissa.dress_code: Beachwear and light, casual clothing. Sunscreen and hats are must-haves for boat trips.
mirissa.why_choose: Mirissa is the perfect destination for marine life enthusiasts and those seeking a picturesque, relaxed beach town vibe.
mirissa.subtitle: Whale Watching

arugam-bay.title: Arugam Bay - Sri Lanka’s Surfing Capital
arugam-bay.description_1: Located on the dry and isolated east coast, Arugam Bay is a moon-shaped curl of soft sand that's become a major destination for surfers worldwide.
arugam-bay.description_2: Beyond the breaks, the area offers access to untouched national parks, ancient ruins, and a wonderfully relaxed, bohemian atmosphere.
arugam-bay.highlight_1: Catch some of the best waves in the world at the famous Main Point break.
arugam-bay.highlight_2: Take a lagoon safari in Pottuvil to spot crocodiles and abundant birdlife.
arugam-bay.highlight_3: Visit the nearby Kumana National Park for exceptional bird watching.
arugam-bay.highlight_4: Enjoy the laid-back cafes and reggae bars that line the main street.
arugam-bay.best_time: May to September, when the southeast monsoon creates perfect surfing conditions.
arugam-bay.dress_code: Casual beachwear, surf gear, and light clothing.
arugam-bay.why_choose: Arugam Bay is the ultimate destination for surfers and backpackers looking for great waves and a vibrant, chilled-out community.
arugam-bay.subtitle: Surfing Capital

trincomalee.title: Trincomalee - Pristine Beaches and Deep History
trincomalee.description_1: Trincomalee, built on a peninsula on the east coast, boasts one of the world's finest natural deep-water harbors.
trincomalee.description_2: It is home to the stunning Nilaveli and Uppuveli beaches, historic forts, and significant Hindu and Buddhist temples, offering a mix of culture and absolute relaxation.
trincomalee.highlight_1: Relax on the powdery white sands of Nilaveli Beach.
trincomalee.highlight_2: Snorkel or dive at Pigeon Island National Park, teeming with coral and marine life.
trincomalee.highlight_3: Visit the historic Koneswaram Temple perched high above the ocean.
trincomalee.highlight_4: Explore Fort Frederick, a Portuguese-built fort still in use today.
trincomalee.best_time: May to October is ideal for beach activities and diving on the east coast.
trincomalee.dress_code: Light beachwear. Modest dress required when visiting temples.
trincomalee.why_choose: Trincomalee offers some of Sri Lanka's most beautiful, unspoiled beaches combined with profound historical and religious significance.
trincomalee.subtitle: Crystal Clear Beaches

anuradhapura.title: Anuradhapura - The Ancient Sacred City
anuradhapura.description_1: Anuradhapura is one of the ancient capitals of Sri Lanka, famous for its well-preserved ruins of ancient Lankan civilization.
anuradhapura.description_2: It is an unmissable destination for those interested in history and Buddhism, housing sprawling ancient dagobas, monasteries, and palaces.
anuradhapura.highlight_1: Pay respects at the Jaya Sri Maha Bodhi, the oldest historically authenticated tree in the world.
anuradhapura.highlight_2: Marvel at the massive Ruwanwelisaya stupa, an architectural marvel.
anuradhapura.highlight_3: Explore the expansive ruins of the Abhayagiri Monastery complex.
anuradhapura.highlight_4: Rent a bicycle to leisurely navigate the extensive archaeological park.
anuradhapura.best_time: May to September. Avoid full moon poya days if you want to avoid massive crowds of pilgrims.
anuradhapura.dress_code: Strictly modest clothing (covering shoulders and knees) preferably white, and easy-to-remove footwear for temple visits.
anuradhapura.why_choose: Anuradhapura provides a profound look into Sri Lanka's glorious ancient past and its deep-rooted Buddhist heritage.
anuradhapura.subtitle: Sacred City

polonnaruwa.title: Polonnaruwa - The Medieval Capital
polonnaruwa.description_1: The second most ancient of Sri Lanka's kingdoms, Polonnaruwa was first declared the capital city by King Vijayabahu I.
polonnaruwa.description_2: Today, it is a UNESCO World Heritage site known for its extensive, remarkably preserved ruins of palaces, bathing pools, and magnificent Buddha statues.
polonnaruwa.highlight_1: Witness the breathtaking rock-cut Buddha statues at the Gal Vihara.
polonnaruwa.highlight_2: Explore the ruins of the Royal Palace and the Audience Hall.
polonnaruwa.highlight_3: Visit the Quadrangle, the most concentrated collection of ancient buildings.
polonnaruwa.highlight_4: Cycle around the massive Parakrama Samudra, a vast ancient reservoir.
polonnaruwa.best_time: May to October. Early morning or late afternoon visits are best to avoid the midday sun.
polonnaruwa.dress_code: Modest clothing for religious sites. Comfortable walking shoes and sun protection are necessary.
polonnaruwa.why_choose: Polonnaruwa offers a more compact and arguably better-preserved ancient city experience compared to Anuradhapura.
polonnaruwa.subtitle: Ancient City

dambulla-cave-temple.title: Dambulla Cave Temple - The Golden Rock Shrine
dambulla-cave-temple.description_1: A sacred pilgrimage site for 22 centuries, this cave monastery is the largest, best-preserved cave-temple complex in Sri Lanka.
dambulla-cave-temple.description_2: The Buddhist mural paintings (covering an area of 2,100 square meters) are of particular importance, as are the 157 statues.
dambulla-cave-temple.highlight_1: Admire the intricate ceiling murals tracing the life of Buddha.
dambulla-cave-temple.highlight_2: See the massive 14-meter reclining Buddha carved out of rock.
dambulla-cave-temple.highlight_3: Enjoy the panoramic views of the surrounding countryside from the rock summit.
dambulla-cave-temple.highlight_4: Visit the Golden Temple and the Buddhist Museum at the base.
dambulla-cave-temple.best_time: Early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat during the climb.
dambulla-cave-temple.dress_code: Shoulders and knees must be covered. Hats must be removed, and shoes left at the entrance.
dambulla-cave-temple.why_choose: Dambulla offers an awe-inspiring display of ancient religious art and devotion in a visually stunning setting.
dambulla-cave-temple.subtitle: Dambulla

bentota.title: Bentota - The Water Sports Capital
bentota.description_1: Bentota is a coastal town in Sri Lanka, located 65 kilometers south of Colombo. It offers a unique setting where a lagoon meets the Indian Ocean.
bentota.description_2: It is the prime destination on the island for water sports enthusiasts, while also offering luxury resorts and beautiful, palm-fringed beaches.
bentota.highlight_1: Engage in thrilling water sports like jet skiing, windsurfing, and wakeboarding.
bentota.highlight_2: Take a tranquil boat safari through the mangroves of the Madu River.
bentota.highlight_3: Visit the brief garden, the beautiful former home of landscape architect Bevis Bawa.
bentota.highlight_4: Relax at high-end spas and luxury Ayurvedic retreats.
bentota.best_time: November to April for the best beach and ocean conditions.
bentota.dress_code: Beachwear and casual clothing. Active wear if participating in water sports.
bentota.why_choose: Bentota is the perfect blend of high-adrenaline water sports and luxurious beachside relaxation.
bentota.subtitle: Water Sports

hikkaduwa.title: Hikkaduwa - Corals, Turtles, and Nightlife
hikkaduwa.description_1: Hikkaduwa is a small town on the south coast of Sri Lanka. It was the country's first beach resort and remains extremely popular.
hikkaduwa.description_2: It is famous for its coral sanctuary, consistent surfing waves, and a lively atmosphere with numerous beach bars and seafood restaurants.
hikkaduwa.highlight_1: Snorkel in the shallow waters of the Hikkaduwa Coral Sanctuary.
hikkaduwa.highlight_2: Interact with giant sea turtles that frequently visit the shoreline.
hikkaduwa.highlight_3: Catch good, consistent waves perfect for beginner and intermediate surfers.
hikkaduwa.highlight_4: Enjoy the vibrant beachside restaurant and nightlife scene.
hikkaduwa.best_time: November to April provides the best snorkeling visibility and surfing conditions.
hikkaduwa.dress_code: Casual beachwear. Snorkel gear is useful (though easily rentable locally).
hikkaduwa.why_choose: Hikkaduwa offers a lively, classic beach holiday experience with easy access to incredible marine life.
hikkaduwa.subtitle: Coral Reefs

udawalawe.title: Udawalawe - The Elephant Sanctuary
udawalawe.description_1: Udawalawe National Park lies on the boundary of Sri Lanka's wet and dry zones. The park was created to provide a sanctuary for wild animals displaced by the construction of the Udawalawe Reservoir.
udawalawe.description_2: It is arguably the best place in Sri Lanka to see wild elephants year-round, thanks to the vast reservoir that constantly attracts them.
udawalawe.highlight_1: Take a jeep safari for guaranteed sightings of wild elephants.
udawalawe.highlight_2: Visit the Udawalawe Elephant Transit Home, which rehabilitates orphaned elephant calves.
udawalawe.highlight_3: Spot a rich variety of birdlife, including birds of prey and water birds.
udawalawe.highlight_4: Enjoy the beautiful, open landscape surrounding the massive reservoir.
udawalawe.best_time: Year-round, but May to September is particularly good for elephant sightings.
udawalawe.dress_code: Neutral-colored clothing, hats, and sunscreen for the safari.
udawalawe.why_choose: If seeing wild elephants up close in their natural habitat is your priority, Udawalawe is unmatched.
udawalawe.subtitle: Elephant Safari

jaffna.title: Jaffna - The Vibrant Northern Capital
jaffna.description_1: Jaffna, the capital city of the Northern Province, offers a distinctively different experience from the rest of Sri Lanka, deeply influenced by Tamil culture.
jaffna.description_2: After years of isolation, it's opening up, revealing gorgeous colonial architecture, fascinating temples, and incredible, spicy cuisine.
jaffna.highlight_1: Explore the impressive star-shaped Jaffna Fort built by the Dutch.
jaffna.highlight_2: Visit the vibrant and incredibly detailed Nallur Kandaswamy Hindu Temple.
jaffna.highlight_3: Take a boat trip to the remote islands of Delft and Nainativu.
jaffna.highlight_4: Sample unique, fiery Jaffna cuisine, known for its incredible seafood dishes.
jaffna.best_time: January to May provides dry weather, though the region is accessible year-round.
jaffna.dress_code: Modest clothing. Men must remove shirts to enter certain Hindu temple sanctums.
jaffna.why_choose: Jaffna offers an authentic, off-the-beaten-path cultural experience and cuisine quite different from the southern regions.
jaffna.subtitle: Unique Heritage

horton-plains.title: Horton Plains - The High-Altitude Wilderness
horton-plains.description_1: Horton Plains is a protected national park located in the central highlands. This plateau at an altitude of 2,100–2,300 meters is rich in biodiversity.
horton-plains.description_2: The landscape consists of wild grasslands interspersed with patches of thick montane cloud forests. It is a highly popular destination for trekkers.
horton-plains.highlight_1: Hike to the dramatic 'World’s End', a sheer drop of over 800 meters.
horton-plains.highlight_2: Trek to the beautiful Baker's Falls.
horton-plains.highlight_3: Spot herds of Sambar deer grazing in the plains.
horton-plains.highlight_4: Enjoy the unique, surreal atmosphere of the misty cloud forests.
horton-plains.best_time: January to March, arriving before 9 AM to avoid the mist obscuring World's End.
horton-plains.dress_code: Sturdy walking shoes, leeches socks, and very warm clothing (it can be freezing early morning).
horton-plains.why_choose: Horton Plains offers one of Sri Lanka's most iconic and otherworldly hikes.
horton-plains.subtitle: National Park

kataragama.title: Kataragama - The Sacred Pilgrimage Town
kataragama.description_1: Kataragama is a pilgrimage town sacred to Buddhist, Hindu, and indigenous Vedda people of Sri Lanka. People from South India also go there to worship.
kataragama.description_2: The town comes alive with devotion, particularly during the evening poojas (offerings) and the grand July festival, focusing on the deity Skanda-Murukan.
kataragama.highlight_1: Experience the intense devotion and vibrant energy of the evening pooja.
kataragama.highlight_2: Visit the ancient Kiri Vehera stupa located near the main temple.
kataragama.highlight_3: Observe the daily rituals of pilgrims bathing in the Menik Ganga (river).
kataragama.highlight_4: Witness the spectacular Esala Perahera festival if visiting in July/August.
kataragama.best_time: July and August for the vibrant festivals, or year-round for an authentic spiritual experience.
kataragama.dress_code: Strictly modest clothing, predominantly white, required for all temple visits.
kataragama.why_choose: Kataragama offers a rare and powerful glimpse into the unifying spiritual practices of Sri Lanka's different faiths.
kataragama.subtitle: Pilgrimage Site

negombo.title: Negombo - The Coastal Gateway
negombo.description_1: Located just a short drive from the international airport, Negombo is often the first or last stop for travelers.
negombo.description_2: It is a bustling coastal city known for its centuries-old fishing industry, wide sandy beaches, and significant Catholic heritage, earning it the nickname 'Little Rome'.
negombo.highlight_1: Visit the bustling early morning fish market (Lellama).
negombo.highlight_2: Take a boat ride along the historic Dutch Canal.
negombo.highlight_3: Relax on the broad, sandy stretches of Negombo Beach.
negombo.highlight_4: Admire the ornate Catholic churches dotting the city.
negombo.best_time: December to April for the best beach weather.
negombo.dress_code: Casual daywear and beachwear. Modest dress when entering churches.
negombo.why_choose: Negombo is a convenient, culturally interesting, and relaxing beachstop close to the airport.
negombo.subtitle: Lagoon Views

colombo.title: Colombo - The Vibrant Commercial Capital
colombo.description_1: Colombo is the commercial capital and largest city of Sri Lanka. It is a bustling, cosmopolitan metropolis that blends its colonial past with rapid modern development.
colombo.description_2: The city offers an array of experiences from exploring historic forts and vibrant street markets to enjoying high-end dining and shopping.
colombo.highlight_1: Stroll down Galle Face Green at sunset and sample local street food.
colombo.highlight_2: Explore the historic colonial architecture in the Fort district.
colombo.highlight_3: Visit the striking Gangaramaya Temple and Seema Malaka on Beira Lake.
colombo.highlight_4: Shop and dine at the beautifully restored Dutch Hospital Precinct.
colombo.best_time: January to March for dry weather, though it's a bustling destination year-round.
colombo.dress_code: Smart-casual for dining and shopping. Modest clothing for temple visits.
colombo.why_choose: Colombo provides a modern, energetic counterpoint to Sri Lanka's ancient sites and beaches, offering excellent dining, shopping, and urban exploring.
colombo.subtitle: Vibrant Capital
